author: etan_status
content:
MEV is extracted using sandwiches / arbitrage and so on, and then submitted as a bid. the two MEV providers that currently produce 90% of the blocks could simply collaborate to insert 1 more tx that sweeps 10% of the mev into their own pockets and lower their bid by 10% accordingly.

and if they collaborate with operators, they can set up a side channel to sweep another 80% of the mev into the operators pocket so that only 10% end up in the smoothing pool for community stake modules.

epbs does not prevent someone from just continuing to use mevboost as today, can just self-build as today or select mevboost with a 0 in-protocol payment. the incentives are set up to favor that

author: terencechain
content: Using a relayer in ePBS has several disadvantages: one is the need to pay the relayer (currently through a second-price auction), and another is that the relayer must receive and simulate the execution payload (non-optimistically) before the 3-second attestation deadline.
